alert.note: Alert for Canyonlands, Natural Bridges; La Sal and Abajo Mountains (Utah) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS GrandJunction (Western Colorado and Eastern Utah)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued October 02 at 5:24PM MDT by NWS GrandJunction
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northeastern San Juan County through 600 PM MDT... At 524 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 12 miles west of La Sal, moving east at 30 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This storm will remain over mainly rural areas of northeastern San Juan County, including the following locations... La Sal Junction. This includes U.S. Highway 191 in Utah between mile markers 92 and 107. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.

area.areaDesc: Canyonlands, Natural Bridges; La Sal and Abajo Mountains
